text: Can from Finger Lakes Beverage Center. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Solid citrus on the nose. Lots of citrus on the tongue. Finished crisp and clean with just a touch of bitterness. Very quaffable!

On tap @ Mikkeller Bar. This one pours a mild golden soft blurry looking body under a medium sized just off-white lacing head. Like the aroma, reminds me of the dry yeast t58?. Its superbly fruity, lots of nice peachy sweetness, lemonade, its well hopped also. Also theres citrus and citrus zest here. Grapefruit and it just oozes fresh. Nice! Really high in the carbonation this, not too aggressive but it almost grows in the mouth. More balanced in the taste. Hay and straw, I get oranges and clementine zest. Lots of lemon in the taste also. Good bitterness in this one. Really flavorful. 15.10.2015

16 ounce can. Pours a hazy straw gold color. Small creamy white head. Fragrant, lemony wheat malt nose has spicy hop notes. Tart, lemon-lime wheat malt flavor front. More juicy, spicy hops come through, though not overpowering. Finish is dry and reminiscent of Ritz crackers. Quite tasty.
Keg at World of Beer Wauwatosa, 9/13/16. Clear yellow, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of tropical fruit, lime, wheat. The taste is lime, wheat, tropical fruit. Thin.

A badass name and a badass can. Thats all Half Acre needed to get my attention. Still, I can never turn down the opportunity to have a great Wheat Ale. And this IS a great one. Cloudy yellow pour. Cracker-like malt. Lemony and grassy hop notes - dank. Theres a pretty big hop presence but very little bitterness. Rich, viscous feel. Dry finish with a lingering hint of sour funk. If only this were in my area...
Can. Pale gold, cloudy. Lemony wheat nose, oranges, herbs. Fully, flakey, wheat biscuit flavor with nice oranges. Good.

Pour is your typical looking wheat beer, cloudy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is nice with a definite wheat malt but there is a nice Australian juicy hop in the background. Flavor is more of a pale ale or IPA with a nice fruity hop with just a little bitterness. Pretty good. At least they just didnt make another boring wheat ale.

Can into a solo cup showing moderate to well filtered honey orange with a half a finger of quickly dissipating white foam.

The nose shows light notes of juicy orange, guava, passionfruit, and 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Flavors of light banana with subtle citric orange and tangerine. Very light bitterness on finish. Moderate citric spiciness throughout and on the finish.
Sampled at RBSG 2016. In the tasting glass yellow with a white head. Nose of floral hops. Medium body. Flavor is lemon and wheat. Finishes with citras zest bitterness. Good.
Hazy yellow. Great citrusy nose. Flavor of bitter lemon citrus with mild grapefruit. Light wheat backbone.
I liked it in general. Real nice aroma. Just a little bit funky in the aftertaste.

16 ounce can canned on June 24, 2016. So about 60 days old. Clear yellow pour nothing outstanding. Taste is another thing altogether a delicious fruity peachy Flavor with a nice amount of hops to complement the sweeter wheat ale. Very drinkable for the summer months - light and flavorful - another highly recommended half acre beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Pours hazy golden, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma is wheat, perfume, pine. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter. Some perfumy floral hops notes and a wheat ale base. Not fresh perhaps? It just arrived here. Light plus body. Meh
Tap at Lucky Well. Hint of haze with gold hue, thin white top. The bite is there, green hop flavor. Mild overall but decent.

RBSG 2016 shared at the Grand Tasting after-party in the hotel lobby. Can. Clear pale yellow. Lemon peel, light grass, lean crackery malts, bitter finish. Great character for a style that usually is boring.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Can pour, hazy pale gold hie with creamy white lasting head, smells wheat, pine and some citrus, medium texture, some crispness, biscuit malt, very drinkable and refreshing, mostly a great pale ale but called a wheat ale, nicd

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz. can. It pours a pale yellow color with a fizzy head. The aroma is strong with grapefruit and light lemon peel. Hints of orange. Lots of citrus and very crisp on the nose. The flavor is the same. Super dry and crisp with hints of orange/grapefruit citrus with almost no maltiness. Light bodied with low citrusy bitterness. A nice crusher for sure.
Hazy, pale gold pour with a white head. The aroma has tropical fruit and wheat. It has a medium body with slightly slick texture and average carbonation. The taste is sweet with a mildly dry finish.

Can from Wegmans poured into a nonic pint glass. Pours slightly hazy pale yellow with nice frothy wheat beer foam. Aroma is mild bubble gum, fresh cut grass, mild esters, and lemon peal. Taste is similar with a clean balanced finish light on yeast. Very nice wheat beer.
Pours gold with a white head. Aroma is citrus, floral and grass. Taste is light bitters, some tartness and a little sweet. Light bodied, easy to drink and a solid wheat with good hops.
Can. Light, crisp, hoppy wheat ale. Notes of zest, spice and grass/floral. The taste of earth is good stuff.
Can - Nice Perfumy hoppy wheat notes. Clear yellow gold with almost no head. Bitter hoppy wheat notes and a light finish. Solid.
Pounder can from Capones. Pours turbid gold with white head. Floral, hops, wheaty malt in the nose. Tastes like a hoppy wheat ale, spicy florals, smooth.Great lacing, and looks like a million bucks.
Can on the RBSG. Pours a cloudy yellow with small frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is floral and wheat. Light body, wheat, lemon zest, fruity finish, very good.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of pine, grains, fruit and some citrus. Taste is fruit and hops.
On tap at TJs. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized head. Citrus, some fruitiness, pine and wheat.

Honey golden with a fluffy white head. Lots of white solids came with the final pour. Wheat crispness and tropical fruit define the aroma. Bitterness is not real big but it is biting and dry. Lots of tropical fruit along with that bitterness. Pine is tasted with tangerine. Grapefruit comes with warming. It works out to be a hoppy wheat ale. This is a pleasant summertime beer and the moderate ABV is appreciated.

Pours lightly hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma is very fruity with tangerine, wheat, tangerine and light pine. It has a lighter body with semi sharp carbonation. The taste has drier malt, woodiness, citrus and pine. Very nice and super easy drinking.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Tastes wheat, hoppy, summery. I thought this was good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice hop aroma and flavor. Light and crisp. A drinkable and refreshing wheat beer.

from a tallboy into a wheat beer glass. Pours a murky hazy orange. Nice hop and fruity ester aroma. Mouthfeel is light and well carbonated. Taste is very mild hop fruit with bubblegum, but its all so subdued. REally not a big fan of the American Wheat ale, aka wheat ale with hops and this didnt do much for me at all.

16 oz can. Pours cloudy golden with an off white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, biscuity malt. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter with a lot of lemony hops dominating. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.

Crap I wrote up an epic, world changing review for this and then my browser froze. Lost forever. Humanity has lost something great. Let me sum it up briefly: 1) spoiled tonights Game of Thrones, saying Jon Snow lives and he in turn spoiled religion by saying theres no God (sorry Ted Cruz), 2) admitted my alcoholism and cursed out Siri for autocorrecting the totally legit word alcoholing to alcoholism, 3) apologized for ticking wheat ales in San Diego instead of joining my wife and baby for their first legit Mothers day, then tried to justify it by referencing Lonely Island - Im a motherlover youre a motherlover we should f each others mothers, Im pushing that lady where you came out as a baby aint no doubt that shit is crazy - ok Ill stop here, 4) raved over ticking a world class wheat ale. SOOOOO here we are with a wheat ale. Clear bright golden color, sweaty glass, with a lacy whIte head. The aroma is what youd hope for, wheaty, honey, floral notes. The flavor is mildly sweet, very balanced, wheaty, honey, light hops. Can you believe this is a good wheat ale and its not hopped to hell or like 13% or sour or something? World getting Cray. Cant believe this beer isnt rekking my taste buds or sobriety (LOL JK LONG GONE) in a non-subtle and balanced way. Medium light bodied, well carbonated, clean and crisp. Nice for what it is!

Gold. Light foamy head, short lasting. Nice aroma sweet fruits. Light floral. Same in taste but with more of a floral hop. Smooth slightly slick but dry with a mild sweetness and a crisp citrus finish. Foamy carbonation. Some pine. Good for a 5.5% wheat beer.
Tap at Craft Heads. Light grassy nose with some lemon and citrus as it warms. Dry on the palate with a creamy, well-rounded mouthfeel. Clean finish. Pretty standard wheat ale.
Its a really nice hoppy wheat beer and I cant believe Im finally trying it while on the other half of the planet. Its got nice lingering but not abrasive bitterness.

Nice aroma of tropical fruit, with some lemon and grassy notes. Cloudy god color with a nice white head....nice lacing. Sweet up front. Lots of citrus/tropical flavors, grapefruit, orange, lemon. Bitterness is mild with a note of pepper at the end....lingers a bit on the tongue. Slightly watery mouth feel....nice carbonation. Refreshing...not bad.

Aroma - tropical fruit, lemon, and juicy tropical fruits - hops are wonderful. Very slight touch of yeast.
Appearance - the body is very slightly hazed pale yellow. The head is 2+" and white. The head holds tight.
Taste - is different than most wheats, the malt is hard to distinguish - the hops however are distinct. Juicy and live action. Floral, citrus, and slightly resin like. Really tasty. The fruit quality comes off as an array of citrus - lemon, tropical ranges from mango to starfruit, and the resin is slightly high-end dank. Its not purest wheat beer, but its also very tasty.
Palate - medium body, smooth texture, average carbonation, fruity tropical finish.
Local 44, Philadelphia tap: pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is citrus and flowers. Taste is dry and citrusy. Lemon notes are present. Nice level of bitterness. Good finish. Nice beer.

Cloudy, golden-straw, white head, thin lacing, and lite head retention. Lemon, wheat-grain, mild floral, sour, and earthy notes. Medium bodied, sour-bitter notes is offset by grains, and mild creamy texture. Lite bitterness, mild dryness, watery finish, but overall a decent balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. Big wheaty smell. Pours hazy gold. Has a upfront wheat taste. A little roasty malty and a forward orange zest hops and then wheat taste then the malt. Balanced wheat ale.

Clear golden pour with a small white head and very light sticky lacing .... Aroma of floral, grassy and citrusy hops with stone fruit and wheat .... Taste is of floral hops, grassy with a rindy citrus flavor and wheat .... Dry and bitter finish with a lingering floral and rindy flavor .... Thin and decent for a wheat beer
Hazy golden color. Super light fruity but lacking hoppiness. Light body, dry super drinkable but the end is a bit too much two road grain. Decent but nothing uber amazing.

This brew is totally out of character for me but Im trying to rate it fairly. It is a beautiful pour...bright clear yellow...aroma is average. The taste is good for what it is but the strong bitter is what disagrees with me. Though bitter the bitter does not linger so I did manage to drink the entire can which I must say has can art suitable for framing! Though not my kind of brew I wouldnt turn one down of offered again.

Aroma is lovely - bright, clean, citrusy, and a bit of hops. Pours a light pale yellow with a minimal head. Taste is unlike any other wheat beer Ive had - slightly sweet with a hoppy presence, but still very light. Has a bread and citrus aftertaste. This is a really well made hop forward wheat.
On tap in ChiTown with Sholl & Duke. Pours hazy bright gold/yellow, thick frothy white head. Fresh hop, wheat, melon, citrus, grass, apricot, peach.

Pours a very hazy, bright golden orange color with a one finger frothy white head that very slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Excellent retention, taking a while to settle and coating the glass with streaks of soapy lacing.

Subtle floral hop presnce in the aroma with bready yeast, citrus fruit sweetness and zesty spice. Delicate grassy notes with faint resins but the hop presence isnt as strong as I expected. Some peppery spice with clove and coriander along with a strong bread/yeast character followed by orange purée and zesty citrus peel. Somewhat bland.

Full body with a crisp hop bite that provides dry, earthy bitterness that lingers over the sweeter notes and wheat beer characteristics into a slightly tart, dry finish. Usually dont like this style but hops are nicely integrated with grassy pine resins countered by sourdough bread, faint peppery spice, banana and citrus rind. As it warms, the spice elements come forward a bit more complimenting the earthy hops. Really well balanced, refreshing and easy to drink. Great beer for warm weather.

Pours a slightly hazed, bright golden color, with a froth, stable two finger broad head.

Combines a rich hay impression beautifully with juicy, exotic fruits. A pleasant grassy quality ties both aroma directions together, creating a unique, very promising nose. While the hops certainly are more than just a gimmick, this is still far away from becoming an IPA, as the orangy hops illustrate the beers wheat quality, without overwhelming it in any way.

Drinks very creamy, with a lively carbonation splash during the finish, showcasing an utmost refreshing, flavorful, easy drinking beer.

Tastes of dough bread, joined by lime defined hops, mellowed by a gentle aqueous quality, which stays noteable till the very end. The hops evolve to a more prominent level, providing a nice bitter bite, while the soft wheat profile remains visible. Finishes with even more grass coated lemon, white bread and a soft aqueous note.

Very soft and easy drinking with an enjoyable hoppy peak, while not denying its wheat origin, showcased by a smoothing aqueous quality, ensuring that the beer remains easy drinkable.
On tap. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Spicy fruity hoppy aroma. Citrus and spicy hoppy flavor.

Tap / Tirador.
@ Hackneys Printers Row, Chicago, IL, USA
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Wheat, citrusy, fruity, slightly hoppy /Trigo, citrico, afrutado, ligeramente a lupulo.
Tropical aroma, hints of mango, some citrus, grain and zest. Fruity with a dry and hoppy finish. Really well done
16 ounce can. Thanks Nate. Pours a somewhat cloudy pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus and grain. Taste is lemon, tropical, and wheat. Nice one.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Draft at Bru Craft. Mostly clear pale gold pour with a short amount of off-white foam that kept a lasting thin cover and initially left lace. Refreshing full hoppy Wheat Ale. Toasted whole wheat. Citrusy grassy herbal hops. Dried tangerine peels. Cloves. Purple passionfruit. Lemon thyme. Oregano. Basil. Pineapple cores. Bruised Meyer lemons. Unripe bananas. Kaffir lime leaves. Oak and pine. Parsley. Capers. Wildflower honey. Touch sweet. Touch salty. Finishes fairly dry. Unusual and interesting.

2015 can. Pours a light golden, hazy body. Aroma is lemon grass, pine, grass and a little caramel. Taste is the same with a more pronounced citrus flavor and a nice, balanced, grassy bitterness. As it warmed it had almost a peppery, saison flavor. Mouthfeel is thin and dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a murky amber with a finger of white head with de eat retention and good lacing. Aroma is pungent with citrus and tropical fruit, some cattiness and wheat. A nice snap of earthy wheat flavor in the taste that leads into some citrus and mild tropical flavors, followed by a grassy dankness with some salinity. Finishes dry with some mild bitterness. Light bodied with moderate+ carbonation. Really enjoyed the flavors and aroma of this one. Like the dankness and wheat combination.

Draft at Parts and Labor in Chicago. Tropical fruit and fresh spicy hops on the nose. Light bodied, clear pour with no wheat haze. Taste is grassy herbal hops with some apricot and wheat. Clean dry finish. Reminiscent of their flagship Daisy Cutter.
On tap at Bandito Barneys. Cloudy and yellow pour with a big white head. Aroma is lemon and wheat. Taste is almost grassy, more tart lemon, and a nice finish.

16oz can pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Citrus and orange aroma. Taste is the same with big hop finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can. Pours golden orange with a fizzy white head. Aroma is of wheat, citrus, pine, and hops. Definitely doesnt smell like a wheat beer. Taste is of wheat and hops. You can actually taste the wheat, so its not overly hopped. Lots of citrus and pine as well. Lingering taste of pine. Finish is slightly soapy. Drinks really easy.

Light straw yellow with a thick spongy head. Subtle fresh flavor. Taste is well-balanced with slightly sweet grapefruit peel, spice and lemongrass flavors. Light body, slightly oily finish. I wish the body was a little heavier to really bring out the savory wheat character, and the palate is a little flat -- but this is still a good beer.

With Zachary, pours a hazy golden rusty orange color with a large foamy head. Nose is lemony and grainy with an appealing fragrance. Taste is citrusy with a predominance of lemon and some hoppines, not a big wheat ale fan...but this is quite drinkable. Finishes on the same tasting notes, dry and moderately long. Descent ! Quaff Score 7 / 10
Can. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head and aroma of wheat and hops. Taste is bitter, nice hoppy notes with wheat, lemon, and straw with a dry, bitter finish. Light and drinkable

Glass, 8 ounces, draught, drunk at Half Acre, savoured on September 27 2014; eye: reddish brown, hazy, tiny sheet of beige head, good lacing; nose: resinous hops, pine, tropical fruits, pineapple; mouth: resinous hops, pine, tropical fruits, pineapple, dry finale in tropical fruits with presence of malt, full body, average carbonation, quite bitter, harsh texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Verre, 8 onces, en fût, bue chez Half Acre, voyage à Chicago, savourée le 27 septembre 2014; il : brun rouge, voilée, petite couverture de mousse beige, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, pin, fruits tropicaux, ananas; bouche : houblon résineux, pin, fruits tropicaux, ananas, finale sèche en fruits tropicaux avec présence de malt, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, pas mal amère, texture râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Keg at Mikkeller, Stockholm.  Cloudy golden, mid sized head. Light aroma of dill, coconut and citrus. Dry with light body and clean mouthfeel. Mild citrus, some coconut and pine. Low bitterness. Clean and hard, but quite refreshing.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 141024. Fruity and wheaty with notes of straw. The finish is bitter and wheaty with grassy notes.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of straw and wheat. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat, lemons, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

16 oz can pour. Thanks Eugene. Awesome to get the chance to try a brewery that is brand new to me. Pours a super cloudy pineapple juice color. To much surprise to me, the aroma is filled with hops. Amazing hop aroma it is with some citrus. Not your typical wheat ale in my opinion. A lot of citrus flavors thoughout with a mellow hop finish. Really nice, easy drinking beer with a ton of flavor. Orange and lemon for sure. Interesting beer here, I really enjoyed this. Hope to see more from these guys in the near future.

16 oz can generously given out by a coworker and crushed with Honkeybra. Pours a bright, hazy yellow with a white head. So much citrus on the nose, with some lingering sulfur, but its not offensive. Could probably crush this all day.
Tap, dark gold pour, white head, nose is citrus, taste is sweet, sugary, more oranges.

Cans recently shared by Dave and Paul. Thank you.

Hazy golden with a thick, white head. Hop forward aroma with underlying wheat, grass, floral notes. More IPA character than wheat beer, with hops leading the charge. Easy drinking. A tasty beer. It would be easy to have several of these in a session. Well done.

Bottle via Omar, thanks again! Pours a cloudy orange with moderate white head. Aroma of citrus, slightly hoppy and some dry grain. Taste is a hoppy wheat with a very dry backing and finish. Slight grass, nothing great but solid for a wheat beer from my stand point.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: On tap at Firkin. Yellowish golden pour. Where is the down side here ... that Half Acre hoppy blend, with a tasty wheat dry backbone. Excellent summer-y brew. Light to medium bodied. Very hop forward, light-ish and dry. 14.3

Can from unknown via Dan S. Pours a cloudy and effervescent orange, decent amount of off-white head. Aroma citrus, tangerine, orange, lemon zest. Body lively, finish slightly grassy, turns into an acute almost resinous bitterness, without falling over into the dank depths. Well balanced and crisp, Im not gaga for it, but a decent beer.

Taster on tap at the brewery. Akari Shogun is a light cloudy gold with a filmy ring of foam around the rim of the glass. Juicy lemon/citrus aroma from the oz/NZ hops. The taste is light wheat but mostly fruity citrus and quite juicy. A solid beer.

Pale golden color out of the can with a foamy, sticky white head. Fresh tropical fruity hop nose with lots of orange notes. This is a hoppy wheat beer with tons of tangerine and orange citrus flavors, some tropical fruit sweetness and a coarse bread maltiness. Very nice beer.
Can. Hazy gold pour, small white head. Some retention/lace. Aroma of wheat, citrus, grassy hop. Taste is bitter, wheat, citrus, quite hoppy. Palate is average carbonation, slick, bitter finish.

Can: Very cloudy, apricot colored body with a semi-chunky, off-white foam that settles quick but lasts for a while as a foamy skin & collar. Aroma of juicy orange flesh, soft wheat, hint of lemon-lime, a bit of earthiness, & a minor tropical fruity note thats hard to pinpoint. Almost like pineapple but very, very subtle. Taste represents more of an earthy & spicy hop leaf flavor, much like a Noble hop would. Dense, with a solid, biting bitterness. Lighter, uplifting fruity notes of orange, citrus, & faint gooseberry pile up nicely over the soft background of heavy wheat & some doughy malt. Lingering, ashy leaf bitterness with a very small dash of citrus peel & wheat. First few sips didnt captivate me, but over the course of the can, this one really opened up nicely. At 5.5% this is nice & crushable, too. Very nice hoppy wheat ale that showcases a heavier spicy/ashy" hop profile than most, but does so nicely.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of light floral hops, citrus, wheat, tropical fruits. Taste of toasty wheat, toffee malts, citrus, light pine, and a hoppy finish.
On tap at Three Aces. Poured hazy dark yellow with thinning white head. Aroma of fruity citrus kinda danky. Light carb med bod. Taste is drying with not fresh hop taste. :(

Pours hazy white lemony unclear with a white head. Aroma is a bit too subtle, notes of juicy tropical and citrus fruit. Flavor brings delicious fruity citrus Motueka hops that dominate that palate so nicely and bring a juicy body. The flavor of the wheat comes on the backend.

Can: Pour is cloudy lemon gold with a frothy, fine bubbled two finger white head into this glass. It retains on the average side, with some cob web presence. Theres certainly a deficiency in the style out there ; therefore, its a welcome addition to anyones local repertoire, I believe. I cant speak directly for Motueka hops, lacking the brewing experience in it but the distinction is fairly immediate here. Theres a floral note but its earthen, with light tangerine presence and a hint of spice. The flavor profile is more bittering hops than I suppose I expected, and thats ok. It moves to peach, citrus rind, with a mild mannered balancing act from the malt bill. The wheat is feint initially, and that is also ok : their goal was to highlight the hops, and frankly the mouthfeel and bitterness level reminds of Daisy Cutter, which is not a surprise.
On tap at Dog & Bull in Croydon - this reminded me of an IPA - just not super hoppy. Pretty good stuff.
Can. Pours cloudy gold white head. Nose/taste of wheat, grain, banana, toast and hops. Some grass. Medium body.

Tall can thanks to Frank. Obviously drank from the can. Artwork is cool but lacks any eagles or 80s sports cars, but does have an imaginary animal thing. 4/5 on appearance. Nose is tropical and fruit, like fruity pebbles. Taste is initially grainy with a slight sweetness, then a fruity hop flavor kicks in. Finishes dry with a hop touch. Slightly metallic taste, that could either be the can, or the can messing with my head. Pretty tasty. Would crush a lot on the beach.

酸味が強い  
ポップの香り&
Aroma comes across as a DIPA, but the taste doesnt match and reminds me that this is a wheat ale instead. First brew from this brewery and has me looking forward to getting more!

Location: Draft at Three Aces, 6/9/14


Aroma: The aroma is fruit and wheat, with peach, apricot, tropical fruit, and some lemon

Appearance: It pours a couldy yellow-orange color with a white head and some decent lace

Flavor: The flavor is much the same, wheaty and fruity, with a nice bitterness to it

Palate: The body is medium, it has an average carbonation, and a clean, dry finish

Overall Impression: 
I quite enjoyed this one. Its a very nice example of the hoppy wheat beer style. If you like wheat beers, you like hops, and you like well crafted beers, you really cannot go wrong here.
Can. Pours a off-orange with white head. Nose is tropical fruit with the usual wheat style aromas. Taste is a typical wheat beer but with heaps of fruity hops added. Works well.
Can. Golden pour with white head. Light grassy and herbal hops with some lighter wheat aromas. Light citrus and grassy aromas, light wheat and other malt tones.

Can. Pours hazy yellow gold with small off-white head. Aroma is really lovely grassy hops, citrus, some tropical fruit notes, banana, spicy yeast. T is light and citrusy hops, pine, some sweet malt character, peach, and an almost hefeweizen quality. Not watery. So refreshing and good.

This is one of those wheat beers that is basically an American Pale Ale brewed w/ wheat. Hey, whatever works. This stuff is pretty tasty. Poured from a can, its quite cloudy in appearance, yellow w/ a foamy head. This is very much a hop-centric brew, grassy and herbal w/ a good bit of melon and citrus as well. There is a slight tea-like astringency which has a drying effect on the tongue. A touch of sweetness emphasizes the fruitiness of the hops and while the nose on this is hardly a knockout on its own, it is still very flavorful. This is a medium bodied beer w/ mild and fine carbonation. For a lighter, hoppy beer, I prefer a bit more spunky carbonation but apparently the folks at Half Acre like it more mild on that note, Id say if you enjoy Half Acres flagship, you will like this quite a lot as well. They are very much cut from the same cloth: pale ales w/ lots of hop flavor that go easy on the bitterness in the finish. This is definitely one where you could pick up a couple four-packs to keep you company on a long summer afternoon.

Tap. Cloudy bright lemon hay gold. Some citrus hops, but mild, some grass and hay as well in the aroma. Flavor is quite dry, hay, earthy but zesty citrus hop. Lighter soft body. This is a good brew, but Ive been ruined in a very good way by Right Proper in this arena.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Draft sample at Half Acre. Hazy yellow in its tiny glass, with a thin ring of foam. Mellow smell of orange blossoms. More bitter in the mouth, thanks to the sharpness of those whippersnapper southern hemisphere hops. Finishes with growing sensation of pineapple and orange.

Aroma is citrus, hop resin, mildly perfumed yeast and pine. The flavor is grapefruit, citrus, wheat, fruit, slight hop resin notes, a small hint of heat medium body and a mildly bitter/dry/tangy finish.
Nice hoppy wheat, pours a slightly hazy yellow. Not super complex but a very drinkable, fruity wheat with a clean hop finish.

Love this hoppy beer. Easily crushable and pours with an orange color with a light head. Leaves a bitter taste. Ha at half acre 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the taproom. Pours a very hazy pale golden yellow color with a thin off white head. Aroma is citrusy, tropical fruits, a little soapy. Flavor is a mild sweetness, some wheat, again a little soapy. Light in body. Very drinkable. Tasty wheat beer.

Can from Mikkeller webshop. Pours bright hazy orange with a thick white cap. Nose is loaded with passionfruit and mango with very minimal wheat characteristics. Super hopped up wheat beer. So much tropical punch bowl going on in the taste. Crazy. I think thats why I like this
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 On draft. Pours a pale, straw like color with some lacing. Big hops and citrus notes here, with a good touch of bitterness. Unusual hop profile with a spiced undercurrent.

On tap poured into a 5oz English tulip sampler glass. A primarily citrus aroma starts this one off with a solvent-like note in tow. The citrus is mostly lemon with some orange. Theres also a toasted grain / bready aroma that comes in late. The beer is a very hazy, murky straw yellow with a white head that reduces down to a rind around the edge of the glass with a light little island-like film in the middle and it leaves a light lace on the way down. A medium / medium-light bitterness stands on the forefront with a medium light sweet backing. The light bodies beer has an average amount of soft carbonation and a thin, yet creamy, texture. The finish has some lemon fruitiness, but is mostly dry with a mild toasted grain and grass aftertaste.

Can... Pours clear and yellow with a small, fluffy, white head. Good retention. The nose is resiny and grainy, and accompanied by components of both tropical fruit rinds and soil. Medium-bodied with a lightly buttery mouthfeel and stinging carbonation. The flavor is a marriage of grains and spicy hops, and falls somewhere between medium and heavy bitterness. Finishes crisp, acrid, grassy and fairly dry. Can courtesy of BBB63!

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, floral hops, & citrus; Flavor of malt/wheat, some yeast, hops, grain, and citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Love hoppy wheat brews.

Lemon and grass flavors in the light hazy yellow beer that clears a little as you drink. Not overly bitter which I appreciate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
tap offering @ skylark. clean bright citrusy grapefruit. soft wheat malts. crisp/refreshing. quite drinkable. great juicy hop character, nice clean wheat. not super complex, but quite tasty.

Draft @ Local Option, Chicago, IL. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty peachy hoppy tropical fruit flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty peachy hoppy bitter finish.

On tap at Half Acre. Hazy golden amber with a mini white crown. Aroma of wheat and citrus with honey and pale malts below. Taste is pale and grassy with citrus and light caramel. Aggressively hopped and not bad.

From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and smooth citrusy. Peachy, grainy and citrusy. Smooth fruity, light grainy and toasted malty into the finish. Mild creamy texture. Bitter and fruity finish.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Cloudy yellow - white head. Abricot. Orange. High fruity hoppy. Lught acid notes. Some sweetness. Light bitterness. Zesty bitterness. Nice refreshing.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, cityrus peel, citrus and soap.
Hoppy finish.
Draught at Local Option. Hardly a wheat. Wheat in color but most of that taste is coming from a big hop aroma in the nose. Very good.

Tap at Half Acre Tap Room, Chicago. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin white head. The aroma is very weak yeast. The flavour is weak sour with a citrus acid yeast palate with a short liquorice bitter finish.

Draft at Half Acre taproom. Pours cloudy golden with an off white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, biscuity malt. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter with a lot of lemony hops dominating. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.
Draft at Pequods. Hazy light gold. Malt and citrus/orange flavor. Slight bitterness but overall very smooth. Awesome stuff.

Hazy straw yellow pour with an enormous white, rocky head. Aromas of sparkling hops and some zest. Taste is a little on the weak side... slightly watery, slghtly lacking, but spiked with citrusy notes. I like this, for what it is. Not mind blowing, but decent.

Pours a wheaty gold with an onslaught of billowing white head. The nose is piney hops and grapefruit citrus along with a clean wheat crispness. The taste is bready malt and floral hops, with pine building into the finish. The mouthfeel is decently full for a wheat ale, and with lots of tingly hoppiness. Overall, this is a wonderful and refreshing wheat ale. The fuller body is especially nice and I love the nose on this brew.

Can sample at Canvitational. Poured hazy orange color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate citrus hop and wheat aroma. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Solid brew.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Cloudy pale yellow. Thin body. A lot of fruit flavors going on and some grassy flavors too. Smells intensely of fresh hops but not as bitter drinking. It is OK. Mostly relying on lots of hops. Serving: Can

sampled at GTMW 2013 - cloudy straw colored pour with a thin white head. nice hop aroma; pineapple, mango and orange. clean on the palate, juicy hop flavors mixed with wheat dryness. nice mouthfeel and an overall great (refreshing) beer.

Growler from the brewery. Pours lightly hazy golden with a white head. Aromas of mango, citrus, grassy hops, and some wheat. Flavors of mango, orange, wheat, and a bit of pale malt. Nice amount of hop bitterness. Nice hoppy wheat.

Not my first Shogun...guess I was enjoying them too much to rate.....from Antioch Liquors via the beer frig at the lake. Pours a foggy yellow with your usual 2 or 3 finger head; quickly dissipates with some moderate lacing.

As advertised....the wheaty nose and taste blended with a hoppy (spruce / citrus) bite. Wonderful.

Will keep 'em coming....but ONLY IN ILLINOIS!

Very tasty.

---Rated via iPad

On tap at GTMW 2013 - Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Nose is fruity with dank hops, and lightly wheaty malt. Pretty straightforward. Taste is dank mango hops, nice wheat and dry pale malt. Gentle carbonation and a medium body.

16oz can. Thank you to the owner of Bare Hands brewery. Mostly hazy, golden yellow color. Good thin white head. Good bits and short ropes of lace. Awesome flavor profile. Great, sort of lightly dry wheat aroma, with the perfect amount of grassy, hay-like hops. Some light lemon citrus. Medium body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Lightly dry in the finish. Good hoppy aftertaste. Light to moderate amount of bitter, very nice zesty sweet, just a bit of spice. Probably the most awesome wheat ale Ive ever had. Id have happily shared, but Im glad I got to enjoy this one all to myself.
Can. Thanks Chris. Hazy gold with a off white head. Citrus zest and light malt. Tart, smooth and refreshing.
16oz can pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Citrus and orange aroma. Taste is the same with big hop finish.
Extra from rxeight-thanks, Al! Nose is some wheat and light orange and grassy hops. Very dry...ok. would like a rounder profile.

Aroma is very light overall with some wheat notes, and light fruity hops underneath. Highly carbonated with strong resiny hop character that dominates the flavour. Finishes very bitter. Strangely low aroma for the apparent hopping.

ya know, just adding more hops to a wheat beer doesnt really make it better. brew a hefe, a wit. dont want to make an american wheat? i dont blame you. but there are good versions of wheat beers out there, and just adding more hops doesnt just instantly make it better. if anything trying to make a good wheat beer is more challenging than just tossing extra hops in and calling it a day. big problem with a lot of american breweries today.

Can from NobleSquirrel (and previously, pantanap). Pours hazy golden with dissipating white head. Aroma is sort of hempy, like Sorachi Ace, but the description tells me otherwise. Once again, I know nothing about beer. Really reminds me of Brooklyn Sorachi Ace. Also get some other stank in there. Taste brings some wheaty flavors combined with those dank hops. Palate is average to full. Finish brings the bitter in a more significant way than on the palate. I wish I could describe this better, because I really like it. Maybe I just got buzzed quick on other beers before this one.

Can with friends courtesy of Armin. Thanks man!! Pour is hazy lemon peel with a big white head and great lacing. Big hoppy, grassy, citrusy, tangerines, orange peel, pineapples, and wheaty aroma. Taste is big hoppy, grassy, light weedy, biscuit, straw, grapefruity, and citrusy with a medium bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Nice refreshing wheat pale ale.

Pour out of 16 oz can, thanks Matt! Very hazy yellow pour with lacing white head, aroma brought notes of nice lemon, biscuit, nice lemon peel, earthy spice, hints of cracker, nice orange as well, really refreshing smell. Taste is very refreshing, nice lemon, lemon peel, grass, biscuit, slight orange peel, finishing with a hint of earth, spice, more lemon, slightly bitter. Could chug this stuff.

Can from brewery. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Aroma of grapefruit and other fruity hops. Light dry wheat taste, leading into slight grapefruit-and-other-fruit notes, and finally a bitter finish. Light body. Good stuff.

Pours very cloudy gold. Nice frothy head with pretty lacing. Smell has sweet citrusy aroma with a wallop of funky fresh hop aroma. Even more funk than I get with some of my favorite IPA's. The taste is much more balanced than the smell but the hops quickly take over to bitter the finish. I love the play between hoppy and sweet refreshment, but I think this rides a little too much in the hop side for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can thanks to a friend. Crisp gold yellow with a white. Nose is fresh hops, light wheat, crisp and clean. Easy palate, super fresh hops, grapefruit, clean, refreshing.

Hazy yellow orangish pour from a cool looking can. Not sure how you get Akari Shogun from American wheat and New Zealand hops, but ok. This does remind me of the awesome Akari Warriors arcade game that you could play with two people with wierd turning joysticks. That game was awesome, especially when you got into a tank. Oh ya, this beer is good. Hoppy, wheaty, good.
Bottle at Maxs. Pours a light golden, hazy body. Aroma is light, dusty hop, floral and citrus notes. Mouthfeel is medium, fresh and refreshing with notes of flowers and dry bitter hop. Nice overall.
Can. Pours gold with a white head. Fruity hops, light pale malts, wheat, and medium bitterness through the finish. Fresh and easy drinking. Nice.

Its an American wheat! Tastes a little thinner and less crisp than their first release of this in the bomber. That said awesome beer with half acres hop up front way about it. Its got the light wheat feel with a super nice hop nose and tastes with good bitterness. Kind of big brother to TALLGRASS halcyon( forget the rating ) Thats an American wheat worth trying along with lagunitas little sumpin sumpin...go half acre!!!

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2013 Can @ TheAlum. Thanks Adam! Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with a white head. Fairly spicy, dank, grapefruity hoppy, lightly sweet, soft yeasty aroma. Tropical fruity, light pineapple, grapefruity, quite spicy, light white wine, light ganja, a bit dank hoppy flavor. Tasty, hoppy wheat beer.

Can poured into glass. Good amount of hops to this one. They sort of almost dominate the wheat flavors and such,but it doesnt really take away from the drinking experience itself. Its certainly a solid beer.

Can at Maxs for Jens going away tasting.  Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head.  Soft musk on the nose, a bit of wheat. Medium bodied, musky, sweet, a touch catty.  Easy drinking, soft wheat into the finish.

Can at Maxs tasting. Pours cloudy light yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma and taste is lots of lemon and orange juice and zest, hops and some slight notes of wheat. Bright and clean finish, very nice session beer. Good stuff.

16 ounce can. Pours a somewhat cloudy orange color with a medium white head. A big fruity nose, light grain. A sweet flavor with huge citrus, tangerine, lemon zest, some earthy wheat. Superbly drinkable and tasty. Great invention.

On tap at Local 44. Cloudy yellow orange with a white head.  Nose is quite subtle citrus peel and grass; wheres the wheat?  Medium body with a smooth bite.  Taste is more hoppy than wheaty with citrus pith and green banana.  Looking forward to sessioning a few cans of this over the summer.
Glowing deep orange body with a large fluffy white head and spotty lacing . show orange zest, coriander and light wheat. medium-bodied with assertive carbonation and a clean refreshing finish.
Sample at local 44, murky pour with lots of soapy white lacing. Notes are lots of coriander, malt, orange spice. Creamy and sessionable mouthfeel. Too fruity and spicy, needed more hops.
Really nice citrus presence with a bit of a tropical and floral background. Light body and quite crisp. Excellent.

Can. Thanks to Kan. Hazy yellow with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is mainly of citrus hops along with peaches/mango, slight herbal presence and light wheat notes. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with a lot of citrus, malt, wheat and herbal notes. Medium body. Slightly dry. Crisp. Good wheat beer, though the wheat is very subtle because its hidden by the important amount of hops in there. Refreshing and sessionable.
On tap at little goat. One note overhopped blech. Exactly what I should have expected from half acre. Boring somewhat hoppy wheat ale with no depth of flavor.

From a can, pours a cloudy peach with a medium white head.  Nose is a healthy dose of sweet citrus and herbal hops.  Lots of estery sweetness in there and a hop expression not unlike other Half Acre beers Ive had.  Mouth is dry, herbal hops and a nice fruit edge.  As with Daisy Cutter, the mouth is super dry and herbal despite an expressive, bright, and fruity nose.  Feel is fluffy and chewier than the pale ales.  Enjoyable.

Draft at Goose island block party.  Ill just go out and say this is a gumball head copy.  And that is one of my favorites.  Crisp, citrius hoppy, some malty backbone and a touch of wheat but almost covered by the hops.  Good stuff.
Draft at longman and eagle, Chicago. Hazed yellow pour. Citrusy, wheaty and good dose of bitterness. Very nice hoppy wheat
On tap at Half Acre, Hazy yellow pour, minimal white head. Aroma of grain and some lemon. Taste of some wheat and very light lemon in the back

On tap at Small Bar. Pours a slightly cloudy gold with an orange hue and a near white head that dissipates to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has a great combination of grassy hops, light wheat and a touch of Mary Jane. Flavor has a similar combination of grass, marijuana and light wheat with a touch of underlying wheat.
Had it on tap at the Village Tap, in Roscoe Vollage in Chicago. Poured a hazy orange hue with a slight but creamy head and uneven lacing. The taste was smooth citrus hop taste.

Enjoyed on tap at Bad Apple in Chicago, IL.  Appearance is a cloudy bright gold with a rich white head.  Aroma of light wheat, very mild citrus.  Taste goes down dry with wheat and citrus notes.  Nothing too crazy about this one, nice to enjoy outside on a warm spring day.

Draft at Jerrys. Cloudy yellow with decent, creamy, white head / Bright nose of weed, pine, citrus, tropical fruit, cream / Light body, crisp and dry, maybe a touch thin but debatable and with otherwise fine balance, and nice bitter finish / Stylish flavors of straw, lemon, pear, pineapple, spruce, weed / Superb, especially as a summer patio quaffer.

16 can, purchased at Half Acre. Pours an opaque, yellowish-orange with a white head and some lacing.  Aroma is hoppy, pine, pineapple, mango, a little grass.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, bready, wheat, some pine hope, orange maybe, with a bitter finish that sticks around for a while.  A nice Gumballhead-esque beer.

Tap at Churchkey for CBC. Pours a clear orange gold. Medium white head. Webby lacing. Nose is pretty different: moderate grated cheese, fresh orange juice, blood orange, spicy potpourri, dried orange peel, rose water, perfume medley. Taste is orange juice, grapefruit, very floral and dry perfumey without any chemical harshness. Moderate butteriness adds some needed body. Seems to work well.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2014 Hoppy, spicy wheat beer. It has lingered on the shelf by me and was on sale but still tastes alright.

Fresh on draft at the source it is epic.

Bomber.  Poured cloudy medium golden with an easily-resuscitated eggshell head.  The aroma picked up a whole helluva lot of fresh, bright hops (pineapple, ginger, and orange led).. soft red wheat down there, but the hops stole the show.  The flavor found juicy tropical fruit and floral bitterness plus a touch of wheat tartness throughout.. soft carbonation and lightly-toasted wheat at the core.. finished with a lot of the aforementioned, tasty hops.  Medium-bodied, mightily hoppy, and tangy on the palate.. smooth, filling carbonation.. good feel to it.  This was a really good brew!

22 ounce bottle poured a cloudy orange color, aromas of peach fuzz, light wheat, some citrus, and light flowers.  Flavors are a nice helping of wheat and citrus, light grapefruit bitterness up front, but balanced with the wheat and citrus flavors in the back end.
Super cloudy yellow/orange draft pour. Peach and fruity aroma. Smells amazing.  Dry and easy drinking. Fruity and a little bitter.  Good for a wheat!

Bottle from pawola.  Hazy peach color with a small white head.  Loads of citrus and wheat in the aroma with some floral notes.  Taste is very citrus forward with light peach notes.  Good dose of grapefruit up front and in the finish, and a strong wheat character in this brew as well.  Pretty damn enjoyable for an American wheat beer, and the aggressive hopping really turns this in to a top notch beer.

22 oz. bottle served in a Firestone Walker tulip.

A: Pours a semi hazy golden color with a thick white head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thick collar and leaves some spotty lace down the glass.

S: Fruity hops and cracked wheat dominate the nose. Some citrus flesh and berry flavors with a little bit of lemon.

T: Pure dried wheat flavors with a nice fruity body mixing in. Semi bitter hops with some grassy flavors as well. Nicely balanced and easy drinking.

M: Light bodied with a clean finish. Sweet wheat on the finish with nice carbonation.

O: Really impressed with the balance and easy drinking of this beer. I hope this makes more appearances in the HA rotation.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-08-2012

Very murky yellow-orange with scant head.  Fantastic nose of cherry, pineapple, other juicy fruits, gumballs, and spruce.  Medium-light body with bright carbonation.  Lots more gumball, with orange zest, and pineapple.  Excellent.  Similar to Gumballhead/Lil Sumpin.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2013 Rerate from can: Nice juicy fruit bitterness with just a touch of dank and herbal notes. Husky wheat finish. I like this a bit more than the first time but alas it aint no Gumballhead.  Original rating... Bomber bottle and served in my Ayinger small glass: Hazy golden hue with a nice frothy head and streams of lace. The aroma is quite grassy, herbal and dank with grapefruit esters along with pale malt and a bit of wheat husks. The taste is sharp and acidic at first with a grapefruit rind overtone. The malt is simply there as background noise. Yes, husky and rind dominated... not nearly as refreshing as the Boulevard 80-Acre I had before it.  While the aforementioned Boulevard exceeded expectations this was a case of simplistic bittering and almost a one note approach. (Yes, too much like my very average home brewed Wheat IPA)

Bomber thanks to Pawola22! Pours a cloudy peach with a medium off-white head. Aroma is extremely fruity, peaches, pineapple, lemon, and grapefruit, with loads of resinous hops and wheat sweetness. Taste of lots of fresh sweet fruits, tropical, citrus. Some wheat and nutty malt with some slightly clean bitter resinous pine hop spice. Clean, crisp and easy drinking. Would be great on a hot summer day. Delicious!!

Bottle from the brewery.  Hazy white maramalade color with a thin white head.  Some wheat hay and grass light aromas.  Tasty light wheat flavors.  Lemon and grassy hops.  Some reminescence of daisy cutter despite the different hops.  A long grassy bitter finish.  Fresh tasty and really good. The price point is pretty nice as well.

Thanks to the kind soul who shared this at the Tampa crew tasting. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is some light wheat with big lemon, hops, and some fruit. Flavor follows the nose. Light to medium in body, very tasty, and session able as hell. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the CBS annual picnic, and self served to clear plastic with a hazed, orangy gold hue, healthy cream & bubbles head, and lasting cling to the waves & spots of lacing. The nose was expressive, white grapefruit scent and light grain. The flavor offered barely a touch of sweetness, soft wheat, but a light soapiness intruded before being erased by a strong, lingering, dry, but acceptable hop astringency. Some watery texture also bummed the experience a bit.
Thanks for sharing this one! Nose is big hops and a touch of lemony wheat. Tons of grapefruit and citrus rind. Taste is pretty much the same with a nice light feel to it. Very nice for a wheat.

In a blind tasting, I might have guessed IPA. The aroma is light and dry with hints of flowers and grapefruit. For a wheat ale, the taste is most certainly pretty absolutely dry and crisp with some lemongrass and a big hop character.

Pours a hazy yellow with no head. Aroma of hoppy wheat, citrus and grapefruit. Taste follows, nice light hoppy wheat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderful nose. Hoppy, fresh, slightly citric. Taste is hoppy with the wheat embracing. HIGH drinkability. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. straw color, with a solid head and good lacing. Nose is light citrus and floral. Very dry overall, medium bodied creaminess with very little in the way of a finish, save for a lingering bitterness towards the back of the throat.
Bottle courtesy of Tooch.  This one really surprised me.  Great light citrusy hops on top of a nice clean wheat ale.  Creamy and smooth mouth feel with light carbonation and bright flavors.
Lightly citrusy and decent hop flavor. Great light sessionable, bitter finish.

22 oz. bomber.  Pours a mellow hazed orange with a thick, milk-white head.  Aroma of bright citrus and pine hops, mandarin orange, pine apple, mango.  Mild spicy wheat notes.  Flavor is bitter, refreshing.  Strong pine and citrus hops, the wheat makes it quite smooth.  Lots of nice tropical fruit notes.  Light, refreshing body.  Nice, hoppy wheat from Half Acre.
A great wheat beer! Big fan. Smooth and doesnt leave that "dry" taste in your mouth. The label has great art but I wouldnt expect a smooth summer beer in the bottle!

Bottle shared at the Royale gathering last night, thanks Jeff! It poured a cloudy orange-amber color with white foam. Strong wet hop aromas: flowery, resiny, citrusy (but not grapefruity), mild herbal tea tannins. No trace of yeast nor alcohol. Hops dominated the flavor, too, but balanced by a nice mellow malt bill, bready, with the slightest amount of caramel. Very crisp, light body, thin but not watery, really allowing the hops to shine. Tangy aftertaste eventually finished dry.

22 oz. bottle shared by Jeff- thanks again, Jeff! Pours a cloudy gold color with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, sweet malts, wheat, herbs, and pineapple. Really fresh. Flavor of wheat, citrus peel, pineapple, and mineral water. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a fruity mouthfeel that becomes drying late in a mineral kind of way. Great, hoppy, fresh wheat ale.

On tap. Hazy yellow with a small white head. The aroma is mellow, mostly wheat, with some light citrus. The flavor is similar, with some lemon, maybe lime on the finish. Bitter finish makes this a little less enjoyable. Light body.

Bottle.  Killer label, wish the beer followed suit.  Light pale yellow pour with a white head.  Grapefruit hop aromas.  No body to speak of, very unbalanced with hints of wheat and an overdose of bitter hops...

Pours a very cloudy golden with a full white head.  Very pleasing aroma of consisting of grass, orange, pineapple, and mango.  Taste is quite grassy over everything else.  Lots of wheat, a bit of lemon, with some bready malts.  Slightly bitter aftertaste of lemon.  Light in body, thin mouthful, with some fizzy carbonation.  Pretty tasty overall.

22oz bomber shared by Brian.  Great tropical hops and wheat aroma, really pleasant and reminiscent of FFF.  Pretty much in the top tier of American Wheats.  Mellow medium body, very refreshing and sessionable.  Soft on the palate, really well executed.  Delicious, world class.
Pours a cloudy golden orange on tap at piece. Head is beautiful.  Nose is hoppy and so is the body. Is is a wheat ale? I dont know. Oh yes there it is.
Cloudy gold color.  Big frothy head.  Aroma of citrus.  Big creamy mouth but was just slightly watery.  Slick too.  Nice hoppy taste.  Some grapefruit and a little grass.  Very easy drinking.

22 oz bottle pours a cloudy light orange with a lasting white head and good lacing.  Aroma is full of grass and citrus hops with a malty backbone.  Taste is slightly sweet at first with a long, clean dry finish.  Medium body and perfect carbonation.  Overall, a very-good, well-hopped wheat beer which Ill gladly try again.

On draught at Hopleaf. Hazed orange pour with a medium white head that dissipates steadily. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of wheat and herbal hops, plus some tropical fruits. Light-bodied with a wheaty character and notes of grapefruit, hops and malt. The finish is fruity with a short wheat aftertaste. Above average overall.

Poured from a growler picked up at the brewery. Cloudy orange colored body with a finger-width, frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a solid lacing. Aroma is crisp pale malts and light wheats with a solid hopping of herbal grapefruits with some grass and florals. A few tropical fruits as well. Flavor is similar. Crisp wheats and pale malts up front with a nice citrus grass, floral, and herbal note. Some tropical fruitiness again in the middle before this finishes dry and crisp with a moderate bitterness and a few more pleasant citruses showing up. Lengthy aftertaste following a light body and a moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid, well hopped wheat beer. Crisp, clean, and easy drinking with a nice citrus and slight tropical fruit backing. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2012 Bottle. Pours hazed golden amber with white head. Aroma is great, big mango and tangerine. Really fresh.
Flavors is heavy on hop flavor great fruit Flavors of mango peach and tangerine. Really clean and mild bitterness. I love this type of beer. To me I could drink this all day and every day, and the malt stays out of the way. Really clean and simple. A magical hop does most of the work. I love magical hops.

Lovely aroma, as always with HA, grassy with some citrus fruit, fresh, oranges.  Hazy light orange with a frothy white head.  Flavor is light and drinkable, well checked bitterness, some soft wheat, light pine, more citrus and touch of grass.  Balanced and very drinkable and enjoyable.
Pours hazy orange with grapefruit that spins into a more grapefruit driven palate that shows the notes of the wheat spice.  Short but flavorful finish.

Bottle from Binnys Marcey. Pours a hazed orange-gold with a resilient fluffy white head. The nose is interesting, citrusy and lemony, hint of passionfruit and faint garlic. Fruity yeast notes as well as some grainy crackers. On tasting, soft with a persistent bitterness that pulls you back in. Lemongrass and citrus dominate here, with some floral tropical notes supporting. Dry finish. Really solid beer overall.

22oz bottle purchased at binnys marcy... bottle yields a hazy somewhat cloudy pale orange brown and topped with a fluffy white head that lingers for a substantial duration... aroma of dank juicy tropical fruits and tangerines, a touch of herbal tea-like essence that coincides with the preceding... flavors are more of the same with orange tangering notes up front while the herbalness and tropical dankness take somewhat of a backseat but are hardly lost in the process.  body is lighter shade of medium and adequate carbonation.  a bit of orange rind bitterness on the backend that prolongs through the finish.  enjoyable.

22 ounce bomber from the brewery.  Im a sucker for good packaging, and the label art on Akari Shogun is especially good.  Normally Im not too thrilled about wheat beers, but this one had a logo that had me sold.  

Im not quite sure how the Asian warrior theme fits in to an American wheat, but after a little wikipedia research, I learned that Akari means "light" or "glimmer" and shogun, as you may already know from movies and video games, means "commander of force."  The "commander of light force," seems an appropriate title for a summer wheat beer, if only it were an Asian wheat beer.  

Which led me to figure out what marks "American" wheats from other wheat beers. This required a worldwide tour on worldwideweb. It turns out that American wheats are not too old of a style, having come about in the 1980s.  Theyre characterized as less spicy and phenolic, due to different yeast cultures than their German wheat (wiessbier: Berlin; hefeweizen: Bavaria) brethren.  Akari Shogun, specifically, is a hazed orange, it thoroughly laces the glass, and it puts off a hearty citrus aroma.  It reminded me a lot of the Half Acre staple, Daisy Cutter.  

Akaris taste had lots of pine and lemony hops.  That makes sense, because they used Motueka hops (thats Motueka, New Zealand), which are known as an especially citrusy variety.  Motueka hops are also known to be Saaz-like in flavor, and Saaz hops are a slightly spicy "noble hop" from the Czech Republic, often used in Bohemian and Czech pilseners, bringing us full circle back to the German neighborhood.  

Back on topic to Akari, there was a certain hollowness to the taste, and I would have liked it if the mouthfeel, texture and flavor were a little more busty.  I would definitely show up for an imperial version of Akari Shogun. Nonetheless, this stuff is very refreshing and enjoyable, and somewhere in the B+ range.

Bomber. Pours a hazy straw color, with a solid head and good lacing. Nose is light citrus and floral. Very dry overall, medium bodied creaminess with very little in the way of a finish, save for a lingering bitterness towards the back of the throat. Decent, but if I were going to pick a wheat beer to drink over and over again, Gumballhead would still be the one.

22 oz bottle from the brewery (Chicago, IL). Pours a well hazed dulled golden hue, darker hue with good firm colors, darkness, and some gentle glowing dulled straw gold edges. A frothy offwhite head sits as a firm small layer, frothy as it sticks around, nice lacing and stick around. Darker with hints of orange, mellow. Aromas are a rich hopping, dry citrusy and earthy hops preach earth, florals, and that telltale New Zealand appeal. Touches of white grape, melon, and florals. Lemon and dry citrusy vibrant aromas. Really nice florals, grass, and fruit with touches of flaked wheat, bready malts. Initial is lighter bodied, a touch of girth with firm floral and fuzzy grass dryness. Earthy hops, touches of white grape, faint melon. Richly bitter and earthy hopping into the middle is fresh and vibrant, giving a touch of bready malts, some flaked wheat, but really this one is all about the hop profile. Its not overdone, or richly bitter but the flavors of the hops stand out, linger on, and give a firm bitterness. Richly earthy, lemon, and white grape. Dandelions, grass, and touches of gentle pine dance in. Really good, fresh, and really drinkable. Good and at $5.99, a steal of a beer.
